D-SALT
About

D-SALT - Datacenter Sender Adaptive Low-Latency Transport

  • Source Code: https://github.com/aistein/d-salt

  • Introduction

    We enable effective use of priority queues in commodity switches through adaptive scheduling policies using dynamic flow control. NS3 Simulation and Cloud-lab Testbed results show upwards of 85% improvement vs. vanilla DCTCP.

    How To Run Simulations

  • May 6, 2018

    Tensorflow Data Formats

    Tensorflow claims that when using nvidia gpus, the data format NCHW is more performant than NHWC for convolutional networks. We use the Tensorflow profiler to show this is the case.

    Tensorboard Alpha Features

  • Apr 25, 2018

    Working With Tfrecords

    Every deep neural network training algorithm revolves around a stream of input data to train on. In Tensorflow the preferred method for data input is via tfrecords. Tfrecords are a binary file format of your data using Googleâ€™s protocol buffers which provide fast and efficient disk reads. Tfrecords also allow datasets to be split across multiple files in case they do not fit in memory.

  • Apr 21, 2018

    Data Ingestion

    Using the recommended data ingestion pipelines can improve gpu utilization from 30% to 61% in simple models, and decrease training time by 50%
